alert.note: Alert for Lafayette (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 2:57PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lafayette Parish through 400 PM CDT... At 257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Arnaudville to near Lafayette. The strong thunderstorm is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Scott, Carencro, Broussard, and Duson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 94 and 107. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
